law.catch_line: Requirements For Other Group Life Insurance Policies

text.section: A group life insurance policy shall not be delivered in the commonwealth unless the commissioner finds that:
the issuance of the group policy is not contrary to the best interests of the public;
the issuance of the group policy would result in economies of acquisition or administration; and
the benefits are reasonable in relation to the premiums charged.
The premium for the policy shall be paid either from the policyholderâ€™s funds or from funds contributed by the covered persons, or from both.
An insurer may exclude or limit the coverage on any person as to whom evidence of individual insurability is not satisfactory to the insurer.
